title: A Survey and Guideline on Privacy Enhancing Technologies for Collaborative Machine Learning
summaries: analyze collaborative ML approaches (including FL), threat models, survey privacy enhancing technologies
systemModel: Traditional centralized ML requires data sharing, which poses privacy and legal risks. Collaborative ML (e.g., Federated Learning) addresses this but still has privacy vulnerabilities.
Privacy Enhancing Technologies (PETs) are essential to mitigate privacy leaks in collaborative ML settings.
Analyze collaborative ML approaches (FL, Split Learning, Decentralized Learning) from a privacy perspective.
Provide a detailed threat model and security/privacy considerations for each collaborative method.
Survey PETs (SMPC, HE, DP, CC) in the context of collaborative ML.
Offer guidelines for selecting PETs based on collaboration requirements and constraints.
